intro: Axinaea rugosa, commonly known as the rough axinaea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and elliptical, rough-textured leaves. Its small, white to pinkish flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy berries. Axinaea rugosa is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests.
